original: A list of top frequently asked  LESS interview questions  and answers are given below.
result: Here are some common questions that are often asked during LESS interviews, along with their corresponding answers.

original: The Learner Style Sheet (Less) is a backward-compatible language that can be compiled into the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) and runs on both the client side and server side. It is an open source language and cross-browser compatible.
result: The Less, or Learner Style Sheet, is a programming language that is supported by CSS and can be used on both client and server sides. It is open source and compatible with all web browsers. Additionally, it provides backward compatibility.

original: The Less programming language was first invented in 2009.
result: Less programming language has been in existence since 2009.

original: The LESS was first written in Ruby in 2009.
result: Originally coded in Ruby in the year 2009, the LESS was developed for the first time.

original: Currently, Less is using JavaScript.
result: Less is currently relying on the use of JavaScript to function.

original: The Less is designed and developed by Alexis Sellier and Dmitry Fadeyev.
result: Alexis Sellier and Dmitry Fadeyev are the creators of the Less project, responsible for its design and development.

original: The ".less" is the extension of the Less file. It is always required to use ".Less" extension in Less document file.
result: Less file extension is denoted by ".less" and is a necessary component of Less document files. It is mandatory to use ".less" extension while working with Less files.

original: There are three ways to use Less:
result: Less can be utilized in three different approaches:

original: Through the command line.
result: One can access commands using the terminal.

original: Through a third-party tool.
result: One way to obtain data is by using a tool provided by a third-party.

original: You can download Less as a script file for the browser.
result: One option for using Less is to download it as a browser script file.

original: It is required to declare a variable with @ symbol and uses a colon (:) to assigned the particular value in the variable. It is also necessary to add a semi-colon (;) after the value of the variable.
result: To create a variable, the @ symbol must be used in combination with a colon (:) to indicate the value assigned to the variable. Additionally, it's important to include a semi-colon (;) after the variable value.

original: In the above example of Less, the two variables used in the Less programming having values #FF7F50 and #800080.
result: The values used in the example of Less programming consist of two variables, namely #FF7F50 and #800080.

original: In Less, Mixins facilitates you to add the set of properties from one rule-set into another rule-set. It includes class names as its properties. Mixins can be declared as the same way as CSS style using a class or id selector. It can store multiple values and can be reused in the code whenever necessary.
result: Mixins in Less allow you to easily transfer a group of properties from one set of CSS rules to another. These properties are defined using class names and can be reused throughout your code. Mixins can be declared just like normal CSS styles using class or id selectors and can store multiple values for easy reuse.

original: The nesting is used to make the code simple, clean and Less complicated by allowing it to follow some visual hierarchy. For example nesting of classes can be done in Less programming.
result: Nesting is a technique employed in programming to simplify and streamline the code by establishing a clear visual hierarchy. Less programming, for instance, enables programmers to implement nested classes.

original: In the above Less document example of nesting myclass is the subclass of container class.
result: The given example in the Less document showcases nesting where the class "myclass" is a part of the "container" class hierarchy.

original: In Less, color channel functions are in-built functions used to set a value about a channel according to the color definition. The HSL colors consist of hue, saturation and lightness channel and the RGB colors consist of a red, green and blue channel.
result: Color channel functions are a set of pre-existing functions in Less that allow users to assign values to specific color channels. These channels differ depending on the color model, with the HSL model consisting of hue, saturation and lightness channels, whereas the RGB model uses red, green and blue channels.

original: With the help of Data URI, an image can be embedded directly in the stylesheet.
result: One can use Data URI to easily include an image directly in the stylesheet, without the need for a separate image file.

original: The "Source Map Less Inline" option represents that all the CSS files must be included into the source map.
result: The option "Source Map Less Inline" involves incorporating all CSS files within the source map.

original: Less is coded in JavaScript.
result: The programming language used to code Less is JavaScript.

original: SASS is coded in ruby.
result: The programming language SASS is written using the Ruby programming language.

original: It is processed on the client side
result: This means that it is processed locally on the device of the user rather than on a remote server.

original: It is processed at the client side.
result: The processing of the data takes place on the client side.

original: Variables are declared with the @ symbol.
result: The declaration of variables is initiated by using the symbol @.

original: Variables are declared with the $ symbol.
result: To declare a variable in PHP, we use the $ symbol.

original: For mixing, it uses Less Mixins.
result: The CSS preprocessor language Sass incorporates Less Mixins for its mixing functionality.

original: For mixing, it uses Compass.
result: Compass is employed to mix the ingredients.

original: Following are the similarities between Less and Sass:
result: The similarities between Less and Sass can be listed as:

original: Namespaces are similar in both.
result: The concept of namespaces is comparable in both programming languages.

original: Color functions are identical in both.
result: The color functions are the same in both programs.

original: Nesting capabilities are identical in both.
result: Both platforms have the same ability to nest content.

original: JavaScript evaluations are identical in both.
result: The results of JavaScript evaluations are the same in both situations.

original: In LESS, &combinator is used to combine the nested selector with the parent selector.
result: LESS provides the &combinator to join a child selector with its parent selector.

original: Yes, Less supports various arithmetic operations such +,? , *, / that can be operated on any color or variable.
result: Less has the capability to perform arithmetic operations on colors and variables, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

original: The escaping is used when there is a requirement to execute CSS file with invalid syntax.
result: Escaping is utilized in situations where there is a need to run a CSS file with syntax that is not valid.

original: Yes, there are various other alternatives can be used in place of Less such as SCSS, stylus.
result: Certainly. There are other options available that can be used as an alternative to Less; for instance, SCSS and stylus.

original: To invoke the compiler follow the below command :
result: To execute the compiler, use the following command:

original: The role of e() function is to escape a value from the Less compiler.
result: The e() function in Less serves the purpose of preventing a value from being interpreted by the compiler by escaping it.

original: When recursive mixins are combined with Pattern matching and guard expressions, it can create various iterative/loop structures.
result: Recursive mixins can be used alongside Pattern matching and guard expressions to generate diverse loop structures.

original: The easiest way to pre-compile a Less into CSS is to use Less.js with Node.js where Less.js run outside the browser.
result: One way to convert Less code to CSS is to use Less.js with Node.js, which allows the conversion to occur outside of a browser environment. This method is straightforward and reliable.

original: The namespaces were used to group the Mixins under a common name. You can perform Encapsulation with the help of Namespaces and Accessors in the Less file.
result: Namespaces serve the purpose of grouping Mixins together with a shared name, enabling Encapsulation through Accessors in the Less file.

original: The scope of variables refers to the place where the variables exist. The variables were searched in the local scope first. If it is not in the local scope, then the compiler search in the parent scope.
result: The term "scope of variables" pertains to the location where variables are present. During programming, the compiler first looks for variables within the local scope. If the variable is not found in the local scope, it is then searched in the parent scope.

original: In the above Less document variable a is defined inside the class with value 20 and variable with the same name is also defined outside the class with value 15. When the compiler executes this Less document, it searches for the local scope first. Hence the local scope of the variable is used. After the compilation process, CSS file is created having font-size value 20px.
result: The Less code above defines a variable 'a' with a value of 20 inside a class. However, there is also a variable with the same name defined outside of the class with a value of 15. During compilation, the local scope of the variable is prioritized. As a result, the compiled CSS file will have a font-size value of 20px.

original: The commenting refers to some text which is understandable by the humans to understand the working of some complex codes in the programming.
result: Commenting is an essential aspect of programming, where a programmer adds text to explain how certain complex codes work. It helps in comprehending the functionality of the program and facilitates better understanding for humans.

original: The reaction of the compiler to the comments is nothing. The compiler ignores the comments at the time of compilation of the code.
result: When it comes to comments in code, the compiler does not take any action. Comments are essentially ignored by the compiler during the process of compiling the code.

original: Two types of comments are allowed in the Less document, inline comments and block comments. However, if you write inline comments in your code, the compiler ignores it and not adds that code to the CSS file. Only block comments will be added to the CSS file.
result: In Less, there are two types of comments that can be used: inline comments and block comments. It's important to note that any inline comments included in the code will be ignored by the compiler and will not be added to the final CSS file. Only block comments will be added to the CSS file.

original: The importing is used to import CSS or Less document into the Less document. Importing can be done by including "@import" followed by the address of the CSS or Less file at the beginning of the Less document.
result: The process of importing is employed to add a CSS or Less file into a Less document. It involves using the "@import" function and providing the location of the desired file at the start of the Less document.

original: The extend is a Less pseudo class which is used to select another selector style in one selector.
result: The Less pseudo class called "extend" lets you incorporate the style of another selector within a single selector.

original: In the above example of extending style class properties have been imported into the properties of h2.
result: The mentioned example illustrates the process of inheriting the style class properties into the properties of h2.

original: The list of different types of functions in Less is as follows:
result: Less, a CSS preprocessor, has various types of functions that can be used. These functions serve different purposes.
